abstract.text: A four-point linear value ramp (gradient) generator.

inlineContent.text: The top-left value of the four-point interpolation.
The top-right value of the four-point interpolation.
The bottom-left value of the four-point interpolation.
The bottom-right value of the four-point interpolation.
The 2D coordinate at which the data is read in order to map the texture onto a surface. The default is to use the current

This node uses bilinear interpolation to create a ramp from four corner values. Any point within the output ramp is a mix of one of the four corner values. A given point is more similar to a corner value the closer its position is to that corner.
Below is a an example of a simple node graph that uses Ramp 4 Corners to create a gradient with four different colors.
The image below shows the resulting texture along with the color values on each corner.

abstract.text: Create custom materials and effects for 3D content in Reality Composer Pro.
Generate 2D gradients, noise, and other patterns programmatically for your material.
A four-point linear value ramp (gradient) generator.
A left-to-right linear value ramp (gradient) generator.
A top-to-bottom linear value ramp (gradient) generator.
A left-to-right split matte, split at a specified U value.
A top-to-bottom split matte, split at a specified V value.
